transportAdvice: The historic medina of Fes is largely pedestrian-only and best explored on foot, though its narrow winding lanes can be disorienting. Petit taxis are widely available for travel between the medina, Ville Nouvelle, and other districts, and a limited city bus network connects major areas.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy with crisp nights; pack layers and a waterproof jacket.
Still cool with periodic rain showers, but days can be pleasantly mild and bright.
Spring begins with warming days and variable weather; light rain remains possible.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with occasional showers and blooming landscapes.
Warm and largely dry with comfortable temperatures; one of the best months to visit.
Hot and dry with long sunny days; stay hydrated and seek shade during midday.
Intense heat with very little rain; early morning and evening exploration is advisable.
Remains very hot and dry; the medina can feel stifling during peak afternoon hours.
Heat begins to ease slightly toward month's end; still warm and mostly sunny.
Comfortable autumn temperatures with increasing chance of rain; a great time to visit.
Noticeably cooler with more frequent rain; evenings require a warm layer.
Cold nights and mild days with regular rainfall; the medina feels quieter and more local.
